alert.note: Alert for Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 12:58PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...An area of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Plumas, northeastern Tehama, northeastern Butte and southwestern Lassen Counties through 200 PM PDT... At 1257 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles north of Chester to Storrie. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. This is within the vicinity of the Dixie burn scar. HAZARD...Half inch hail and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on roadways likely. Locations impacted include... Chester, Mineral, Prattville, Storrie, Lake Almanor, Caribou, Twain, Canyondam, East Shore, Tobin, Lake Almanor Country Club, Seneca, Belden, Lake Almanor Peninsula, Butte Meadows, Mill Creek, Lake Almanor West, Hamilton Branch, Bald Eagle Mountain and Meadow Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
